#Text=Drekale

#Text=Drekale ( Serbian Cyrillic : Дрекале ) was according to tradition the chieftain ( vojvoda , " duke " ) of the Kuči tribe and founder of the Drekalović brotherhood which produced the chieftains of Kuči for three centuries .
#Text=Name
#Text=Drekale is derived from the archaic Slavic Verb dreka ( as in derati se ) " to scream , shout , outcry " . [ 1 ]
#Text=Drekavac , literally " the screamer " , [ 2 ] was the name for a mythological creature in Serbian folklore , a bogeyman ( registered in Serbia , Bosnia and Herzegovina and Montenegro ) . [ 3 ]

column1: #Text=According to Rovinski , Drekale is the Albanian-language corruption of Andrej ; [ 4 ] that being his actual name . [ 5 ]
#Text=History
#Text=Drekale was elected the position of vojvoda ( " duke " ) of the Kuči tribe probably in the second half of the 16th century , based on the proposal of Dreca Dedin . [ 6 ]
#Text=According to a story , vojvoda Žijo Peralov of Kosor married his daughter Mara to Drekale . [ 7 ]
#Text=Their descendants were to be known as Drekalović . [ 8 ]
#Text=There are several stories on his origin .
#Text=One story has Drekale as the " son of a Mrnjavčić and the daughter of Klimenti vojvoda Martin " .
#Text=This would mean that he was a descendant of the Old Kuči . [ 9 ]
#Text=Local legends tell that Drekale was Skanderbeg 's grandson , baptized as a Serbian Orthodox Christian .
#Text=There are three different versions of this connection .
#Text=Two of them say that Drekale ( Andreja ) was the son of Skanderbeg 's daughter Mara and a father from the Klimenti or Bratonožići tribe .
#Text=In reality Skanderbeg never had a daughter .
#Text=According to the third version , Drekale was a son of Skanderbeg 's son Ivan ( Gjon ) . [ 4 ] [ 10 ]

#Text=The connection of Drekale with Skanderbeg , as well as assertions that he was of Albanian origin is widely disputed , since it was impossible for Skanderbeg 's great-grandson to be alive in the second half of the 16th century . [ 11 ]
#Text=According to Edith Durham Drekale descent from Berisha . [ 12 ]
#Text=Legends about the progenitor of the Kastrati say that it was Drekale 's brother who had come from Kuči , while Đ .
#Text=Slijepčević stressed that it was more likely that the progenitor came from Kuči but descended from some other family as Drekale in fact had no brothers . [ 13 ]
#Text=Dreca Dedin in fact passed his own title of Vojvoda to him , impressed by his successful peace negotiations with the Vizier of Skhoder .
#Text=Marko Miljanov points out that he was the first elected Vojvoda , as well as the first Vojvoda of the overall tribe , since at the time the Ottoman authorities appointed one in every village .
#Text=Drekale had two sons , Nikola and Lale .
#Text=According to tradition , Drekale , along with his older son Nikola , was killed in a skirmish by the members of Kelmendi tribe while they were shepherding in the Žijevo mountains .
#Text=His son Lale survived thanks to the fact that , being still young , he switched his clothes in child 's play with a certain Muslim boy from Podgorica by the name of Lisičić .
#Text=Unfortunate boy , who was occasionally shepherding with them , was killed instead .
#Text=Some historians place this event around 1550 . [ 14 ]
#Text=Lale later avenged the death of his father and brother , with the help of Muslims from Podgorica .
#Text=The vengeance is described in epic folk song Priest Milutin and the Drekalovići . [ 15 ]
#Text=Legacy
#Text=Drekale is commemorated in literature and oral traditional poetry , such as Vojvoda Drekale and Vuk of the Klimente . [ 16 ]
#Text=Marko Miljanov wrote about Drekale and his descendants in his works . [ 17 ]
#Text=Simo Matavulj extensively discussed about Drekale in one of his novels . [ 18 ]
